%text For a \underline\text{positive integer $n$}
\[ \qquad (a \pm b)^n = \underbrace{T_1 + T_2 + T_3 + \ldots +T_{n+1}}_{n+1\text{ terms}} \]
where $T_{m+1}$ is the $(m+1)-$th \underline\text{term}.
% \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|} \hline & T_{m+1} & K_{m+1} \\ \hline (a+b)^n & {^n}C_m\cdot a^{n-m}\cdot b^m & {^n}C_m \\ \hline (a-b)^n & {^n}C_m\cdot a^{n-m}\cdot (-1)^mb^m & {^n}C_m \\ \hline \end{tabular} %text
Both expansions have $n+1$ terms. And in both expansions, the $(m+1)^{th}$ coefficient $(K_{m+1})$ is equal to ${^n}C_m$.
The only difference is whether or not there is a $(-1)^m$ term in $T_{m+1}$. %
